content: Are there any examples in the wild of servers advertising their oauth endpoints using the well known URI yet? http://www.hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/conformance/index.html#using-well-known

Will note this is the only way the spec provides to advertise a server's SMART capabilities in a fine grained way; we want to do whatever we can to encourage use (note @Vladimir Ignatov that it would be good for the SMART reference server to cover this :-))
Thanks Michael, Josh. I haven't looked that hard, but I haven't seen any yet.

I know the Finnish PHR reports the information at https://fhirsandbox2-auth.kanta.fi/phr-authserver-sandbox/.well-known/openid-configuration. Note that it's using openid-configuration, not smart-configuration.
That's close :-) Though clients shouldn't be looking for SMART capabilities there.

I just added experimental support to the SMART reference server:
https://launch.smarthealthit.org/v/r3/fhir/.well-known/smart-configuration
https://launch.smarthealthit.org/v/r2/fhir/.well-known/smart-configuration
Great, worked right off the bat w/my client. That's a good sign. Thanks!
